member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.GetWindowRect(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND,Windows.Win32.Foundation.RECT*)
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: Type: HWND A handle to the window.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

param.name: lpRect
param.para: Type: LPRECT A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

returns.para: Type: BOOL If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.SetFocus(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND)
member.summary: Sets the keyboard focus to the specified window. The window must be attached to the calling thread's message queue.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: Type: **HWND** A handle to the window that will receive the keyboard input. If this parameter is NULL, keystrokes are ignored.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

returns.para: Type: **HWND** If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to the window that previously had the keyboard focus. If the *hWnd* parameter is invalid or the window is not attached to the calling thread's message queue, the return value is NULL. To get extended error information, call [GetLastError function](../errhandlingapi/nf-errhandlingapi-getlasterror.md). Extended error ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER (0x57) means that window is in disabled state.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Security.SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: Represents a security identifier (SID) and its attributes.

remarks.para: A group is represented by a SID. SIDs have attributes that indicate whether they are currently enabled, disabled, or mandatory. SIDs also indicate how these attributes are used. A SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES structure can represent a SID whose attributes change frequently. For example, SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES is used to represent groups in the TOKEN_GROUPS structure.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES.Sid
member.summary: A pointer to a SID structure.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES.Attributes
member.summary: Specifies attributes of the SID. This value contains up to 32 one-bit flags. Its meaning depends on the definition and use of the SID.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS
member.summary: Contains values that specify the type of information being assigned to or retrieved from an access token.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

summary.para: The buffer receives a TOKEN_USER structure that contains the user account of the token.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the group accounts associated with the token.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_PRIVILEGES structure that contains the privileges of the token.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_OWNER structure that contains the default owner security identifier (SID) for newly created objects.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_PRIMARY_GROUP structure that contains the default primary group SID for newly created objects.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_DEFAULT_DACL structure that contains the default DACL for newly created objects.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_SOURCE structure that contains the source of the token. TOKEN_QUERY_SOURCE access is needed to retrieve this information.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_TYPE value that indicates whether the token is a primary or impersonation token.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL value that indicates the impersonation level of the token. If the access token is not an impersonation token, the function fails.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_STATISTICS structure that contains various token statistics.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.
The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the list of restricting SIDs in a restricted token.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

The buffer receives a DWORD value that indicates the Terminal Services session identifier that is associated with the token. If the token is associated with the terminal server client session, the session identifier is nonzero. Windows Server2003 and WindowsXP:If the token is associated with the terminal server console session, the session identifier is zero. In a non-Terminal Services environment, the session identifier is zero. If TokenSessionId is set with SetTokenInformation, the application must have the Act As Part Of the Operating System privilege, and the application must be enabled to set the session ID in a token.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenGroupsAndPrivileges
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS_AND_PRIVILEGES structure that contains the user SID, the group accounts, the restricted SIDs, and the authentication ID associated with the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSessionReference
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSandBoxInert
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token includes the SANDBOX_INERT flag.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAuditPolicy
member.summary: Reserved.

summary.para: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ORIGIN value. If the token resulted from a logon that used explicit credentials, such as passing a name, domain, and password to the LogonUser function, then the TOKEN_ORIGIN structure will contain the ID of the logon session that created it. If the token resulted from network authentication, such as a call to AcceptSecurityContext or a call to LogonUser with dwLogonType set to LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK or LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK_CLEARTEXT, then this value will be zero.
Read more on docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenElevationType
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ELEVATION_TYPE value that specifies the elevation level of the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenLinkedToken
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_LINKED_TOKEN structure that contains a handle to another token that is linked to this token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenElevation
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ELEVATION structure that specifies whether the token is elevated.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenHasRestrictions
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token has ever been filtered.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAccessInformation
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_ACCESS_INFORMATION structure that specifies security information contained in the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenVirtualizationAllowed
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if virtualization is allowed for the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenVirtualizationEnabled
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if virtualization is enabled for the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenIntegrityLevel
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_MANDATORY_LABEL structure that specifies the token's integrity level.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenUIAccess
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token has the UIAccess flag set.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenMandatoryPolicy
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_MANDATORY_POLICY structure that specifies the token's mandatory integrity policy.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenLogonSid
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that specifies the token's logon SID.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenIsAppContainer
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that is nonzero if the token is an app container token. Any callers who check the TokenIsAppContainer and have it return 0 should also verify that the caller token is not an identify level impersonation token. If the current token is not an app container but is an identity level token, you should return AccessDenied.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenCapabilities
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the capabilities associated with the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAppContainerSid
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_APPCONTAINER_INFORMATION structure that contains the AppContainerSid associated with the token. If the token is not associated with an app container, the TokenAppContainer member of the TOKEN_APPCONTAINER_INFORMATION structure points to NULL.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenAppContainerNumber
member.summary: The buffer receives a DWORD value that includes the app container number for the token. For tokens that are not app container tokens, this value is zero.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenUserClaimAttributes
member.summary: The buffer receives a CLAIM_SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES_INFORMATION structure that contains the user claims associated with the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenDeviceClaimAttributes
member.summary: The buffer receives a CLAIM_SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES_INFORMATION structure that contains the device claims associated with the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedUserClaimAttributes
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedDeviceClaimAttributes
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenDeviceGroups
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the device groups that are associated with the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenRestrictedDeviceGroups
member.summary: The buffer receives a TOKEN_GROUPS structure that contains the restricted device groups that are associated with the token.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenSecurityAttributes
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.TokenIsRestricted
member.summary: This value is reserved.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS.MaxTokenInfoClass
member.summary: The maximum value for this enumeration.

member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_MANDATORY_LABEL
member.summary: Specifies the mandatory integrity level for a token.

remarks.para: Learn more about this API from docs.microsoft.com.

member.name: F:Windows.Win32.Security.TOKEN_MANDATORY_LABEL.Label
member.summary: A SID_AND_ATTRIBUTES structure that specifies the mandatory integrity level of the token.
